title: Current Credit Card Transfer Bonuses: December 2024
description: Here's a list of current and past transfer bonuses offered by American Express Membership Rewards, Chase Ultimate Rewards, Bilt Rewards, Citi ThankYou and Capital One.
author: Craig Joseph
excerpt: Here's a list of current and past transfer bonuses offered by American Express Membership Rewards, Chase Ultimate Rewards, Bilt Rewards, Citi ThankYou and Capital One.
text: If you’re serious about traveling more for less, a great place to start is by earning transferable points or miles — such as Chase Ultimate Rewards, Capital One Miles, Bilt Rewards and AmEx Membership Rewards. Credit cards that earn these rewards allow you to transfer them to a list of partner airlines or hotel programs, often at a 1:1 ratio.Occasionally, credit card issuers and their travel partners offer transfer bonuses, allowing you to get even more value from your points. For example, if your points transfer to an airline at a 1:1 ratio, and that airline is offering a 25% transfer bonus, transferring 100,000 miles to that airline would net you 125,000 airline miles. That means you can transfer fewer miles to book the same award flight. Who doesn't want to be rewarded?Create a NerdWallet account for personalized recommendations, and find the card that rewards you the most for your spending.Current credit card transfer bonusesA summary of current transfer bonuses offered by the major transferrable point programs includes:Transfer fromTransfer toTransfer bonusStart dateEnd dateAmEx Membership RewardsAvianca LifeMiles15%.Nov. 1, 2024.Dec. 31, 2024.AmEx Membership RewardsVirgin Atlantic Flying Club40%.Dec. 1, 2024.Dec. 31, 2024.AmEx Membership RewardsJetBlue25%.Dec. 6, 2024.Dec. 31, 2024.AmEx Membership RewardsMarriott Bonvoy35%.Nov. 1, 2024.Dec. 31, 2024.Chase Ultimate RewardsAir France/KLM Flying Blue20%.Dec. 4, 2024.Jan. 1, 2015.Chase Ultimate RewardsAir Canada Aeroplan20%.Dec. 4, 2024.Jan. 1, 2015.Chase Ultimate RewardsIHG 70%.Dec. 4, 2024.Jan. 1, 2015.When should you transfer points?You should generally only transfer rewards to airline and hotel partners if you have a specific redemption in mind. Once the rewards are transferred, it can’t be undone. Those rewards are subject to the restrictions of the individual loyalty program, which may include expiration dates or loyalty program devaluations. If you decide to take advantage of a transfer bonus without immediate travel plans, be sure to understand those restrictions before you transfer. Using an award search tool like PointsYeah can help you find redemption options for the transferrable points you’re trying to redeem. You can even filter results to only include transferable points with a current transfer bonus. html:
If you’re serious about traveling more for less, a great place to start is by earning transferable points or miles — such as Chase Ultimate Rewards, Capital One Miles, Bilt Rewards and AmEx Membership Rewards. Credit cards that earn these rewards allow you to transfer them to a list of partner airlines or hotel programs, often at a 1:1 ratio.

Occasionally, credit card issuers and their travel partners offer transfer bonuses, allowing you to get even more value from your points. For example, if your points transfer to an airline at a 1:1 ratio, and that airline is offering a 25% transfer bonus, transferring 100,000 miles to that airline would net you 125,000 airline miles. That means you can transfer fewer miles to book the same award flight.

Who doesn't want to be rewarded?

Create a NerdWallet account for personalized recommendations, and find the card that rewards you the most for your spending.

Current credit card transfer bonuses

A summary of current transfer bonuses offered by the major transferrable point programs includes:

When should you transfer points?

You should generally only transfer rewards to airline and hotel partners if you have a specific redemption in mind. Once the rewards are transferred, it can’t be undone. Those rewards are subject to the restrictions of the individual loyalty program, which may include expiration dates or loyalty program devaluations. If you decide to take advantage of a transfer bonus without immediate travel plans, be sure to understand those restrictions before you transfer.

Using an award search tool like PointsYeah can help you find redemption options for the transferrable points you’re trying to redeem. You can even filter results to only include transferable points with a current transfer bonus.

  • Marriott Hotels & Resorts (1:1 ratio).

AmEx has more airline and hotel partners than Chase, Citi and Capital One. In addition, AmEx has typically offered more transfer bonuses than these other programs.

Cards that earn American Express Membership Rewards points

You’ll need a card that earns AmEx Membership Rewards to take advantage of an AmEx transfer bonus. Here are a few of our favorites.

Credit cards that earn Citi ThankYou points

If you want to take advantage of Citi’s transfer partners, you’ll need to get a credit card from Citi that earns ThankYou points. Unfortunately, not all ThankYou point earning cards give you access to all the transfer partners.

However, if you have the Citi Strata Premier℠ Card ($95 annual fee) or the Citi Prestige® Card ($495 annual fee), you can access all the transfer partners. In addition, holders of these two cards can transfer points to Choice and Wyndham at more favorable transfer ratios.

Bilt Rewards transfer bonus history

Bilt Rewards is one of the newer rewards programs with transfer partners and can be a valuable program for those who want to pay rent using a credit card. Bilt Rewards points can be transferred to 14 airlines and three hotels.

Complete list of Bilt transfer partners

The best transfer value for Bilt Rewards come during Bilt's Rent Day promotions, which offer high transfer bonuses for just one day. For example, Bilt offered a 100% transfer bonus to Air-France KLM Flying Blue in 2023. Check the Bilt app on the first of every month for any transfer bonuses.

Credit cards that earn Bilt Rewards

Although you don't need to have a credit card with Bilt to earn Bilt points, you can maximize the points you earn by holding the Bilt World Elite Mastercard® Credit Card. There is no annual fee, and it is the easiest way to earn points for paying your rent.
